title: Secant variety
summary: In algebraic geometry, the secant variety Sect ⁡ ( V ) {\displaystyle \operatorname {Sect} (V)} , or the variety of chords, of a projective variety V ⊂ P r {\displaystyle V\subset \mathbb {P} ^{r}} is the Zariski closure of the union of all secant lines (chords) to V in P r {\displaystyle \mathbb {P} ^{r}} :[1]
